strategy_reasoning: Using a cozy 'Market Day' metaphor makes the shift to paid models feel like a natural shop reorganization rather than a restriction. Highlighting 'Gemini Fast' as the reliable free option keeps the vibe positive. The backend fixes are framed as 'garden maintenance' to fit the brand.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of a retro market stall in a garden. A cute 8-bit bee shopkeeper is organizing shelves. One shelf has glowing premium items, another has a big basket labeled 'FREE'. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and peach gradient background. Warm sunlight, chunky sprites, Stardew Valley aesthetic. Text in pixel font: 'Market Update'. Nostalgic and welcoming.
images.description: Intro slide setting the scene for the model updates.

images.prompt: Close up pixel art of the market shelves. On the top shelf, fancy exotic pixel potions labeled 'Pro' (Claude, Grok). On the bottom shelf, a bright, glowing, speedy lightning-flower labeled 'Gemini Fast' that is clearly free. Soft lime green (#ecf874) sparkles. 8-bit aesthetic, warm lighting. Text in pixel font: 'Gemini Fast = Still Free'.
images.description: Clarifying which models are moving to paid and which stay free.

images.prompt: Pixel art scene of the 8-bit bee mechanic fixing a water pipe in the garden. The pipe represents the data pipeline. Tiny pixel tools scattered around. A sign says 'Stable'. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and lavender sky. Represents fixing GitHub rate limits and Buffer retries. Cozy, productive vibes like Unpacking. Text in pixel font: 'Bug Squashing'.
images.description: Visualizing the technical fixes (rate limits, buffer retries) as cozy maintenance.

alt_text: Pixel art carousel showing a market stall update. 1: Bee shopkeeper organizing shelves. 2: Comparison of paid models vs free Gemini Fast flower. 3: Bee mechanic fixing garden pipes.
